original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes at 307/308 to US dollar, bond yields up
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka spot closed weaker at 307/308 to the US dollar on Friday, while bond yields were up, dealers said.
The spot closed at 306.75/307.50 to the US dollar on Thursday after opening at 306.50/307.25 rupees.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 23.20/35 percent, up from yesterday’s close at 22.85/23.05 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 closed at 27.25/30 percent, up from yesterday’s closing at 27.15/30 percent.
A three-month maturing bill closed at 22.30/22.70 percent steady from 22.30/80 percent at the last close.
A six-month maturing bill closed at 19.00/25 percent down from 19.20/30 percent at the last close.
A one year maturing bill closed at 16.75/17.25 percent up from 16.30/17.25 percent at the last close.   (Colombo/ June 22/2023)
